title: Tasty Garlic Shrimp
summary: Need a pescatarian main course? Tasty Garlic Shrimp could be an amazing recipe to try. This recipe serves 4 and costs $2.52 per serving. One portion of this dish contains about 31g of protein, 14g of fat, and a total of 428 calories. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. If you have pasta, granulated garlic, medium-large shrimp, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the pasta you could follow this main course with the Chocolate Dessert Pasta as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 4 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 44%. This score is solid. Try Ted's Tasty Shrimp, Tasty Tomatillo Shrimp, and Tasty Shrimp Spread for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Ziobaffan Organic Pinot Grigio with a 4.6 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ziobaffa Organic Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Ziobaffa Organic Pinot Grigio has fresh rich aromas of apples and pears with hints of citrus that fade into a floral bouquet and on the palate it is bright and fresh with wonderful fruit flavors.ZIOBAFFA Pinot Grigio pairs well with a wide array of lighter cuisine, especially fish/shellfish, poultry, pastas in cream sauce and softer cheeses. It's also an ideal aperitif. Blend: 100% Pinot Grigio
